Can someone glamour me out of remembering Orange Is the New Black so I can rewatch...?

— Matthew Gilbert (@MatthewGilbert) July 24, 2013

I was seriously asked to autograph a screwdriver.

— Lea DeLaria (@realleadelaria) July 24, 2013

.@Hbo Why are the characters on The Newsroom always reporting the news? I'm interested in their love lives! Change the name to The Bedroom!

— Scott Aukerman (@ScottAukerman) July 24, 2013

bummed one of my fav TV sites, sold out to the moronic fatcuntbloggers at DixFit. fiendberg, schlepowitz continue to douche and reduce.

— kurt sutter (@sutterink) July 24, 2013

Sorry, @sutterink. "Fiendberg" is my sexting name. You can't ruin it by saying mean things. xoxo http://t.co/jRIibfxa4I

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2013

Checking with FX PR to see if @TVTattle can run a "'One of my fav TV sites.' -Kurt Sutter" banner ad.

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) July 24, 2013

Day 1 of #TCA2013. 8:36 a.m. This is bullshit. I'm out of here.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 24, 2013

ah yes, the #tcas - that magical time of year where tons of people I follow begin tweeting the exact same thing, seconds apart, for 2 weeks.

— Jonathan Toomey (@jt00mey) July 24, 2013

The 2013 TCAs start w/Nat Geo Wild, lots of puppies onstage, mimosas offered to critics at 9 a.m. Do they know this crowd or what? #TCA2013

— Eric Deggans at NPR (@Deggans) July 24, 2013

They brought dogs. THEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEY BROUGHT DOOOOOOOOOOOOOOGSSSSSSSSSSS. #tcas13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2013

Nat Geo Wild has brought a zillion dogs on stage to promote THE SECRET LIFE OF DOGS. Puppies, puppies, puppies! WHEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2013

Day 1 of my very first TCA experience, and it's starting with puppies. Could be worse.

— Meredith Blake (@MeredithBlake) July 24, 2013

I was just told that Nat Geo's "Secret Life of Dogs" goes way deeper than "slobber." I don't understand why that's necessary. #tcas13

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) July 24, 2013

By the way, they started us off this morning with mimosas. I feel like that's some kind of Earliest Formally Presented Booze record. #tcas13

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2013

Watching high def images of animals on NatGeo series such as Secret Life of Dogs @#TCAs2013, convinces me; I'm not writing about them enuf.

— Eric Deggans at NPR (@Deggans) July 24, 2013

First TCA question of the tour involves the words "rectal thermometer." We are *so* ready for you, NBC.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 24, 2013

NOW THERE IS A PIG. I AM SORRY TODAY IS ALL CAPS DAY. PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG PIG IT'S A BABY PIG. #tcas13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2013

Pigs ain't shit. *chews leaf, bitterly*

— Burley (@BurleytheKoala) July 24, 2013

Check your NatGeo swag bag to find your very own baby pig! Raise it well, and a magical spider will compliment you in her web! #tcas13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2013

HOW AM I SUPPOSED TO JOURNALISM WHEN THERE IS A LITTLE TINY PIG? #tcas13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 24, 2013

@tvoti You'l just have to ask it why it's THE CUTEST LITTLE PIG IN THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD!!

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 24, 2013

And a hawk just flew across the ballroom to Jeremy Brandt onstage. and it's only 940am. #tcas13

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) July 24, 2013

Rob Lowe just said "literally" as Rob Lowe and not as Chris Treager and I cried. Figuratively. #TCAs13

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2013

Rob Lowe says Oswald acted alone. And that's good enough for me! #TCAs13

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 24, 2013

To be fair, Harry Potter and the House of Cards is a pretty good title. http://t.co/M2EoDtJZl2 (h/t @mousterpiece)

That being said, if they put Hermione into the #OITNB prison in S2, that would be awesome.

@corybarker "Lillyhammer is the next Sopranos."

Bravo has ordered Game of Crowns, its own Toddlers and Tiaras, except hopefully with beheadings.

George Alexander Louis is a pretty ordinary name, I'm sure twitter won't try to wring jokes from--*stomped to death by rushing crowd*

Prince George Jason Alexander Louis CK. Totally called that, guys. #RoyalBaby

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 24, 2013

George Alexander Louis. G.A.L.? Gal! YOU'RE A GAL! HAHAHAHAHA"--Nelson Muntz

So honored that the future King of England will bear the proud and noble name of "George". Serenity Now!

With a name like George Alexander Louis, the royal baby is destined to have three names.

— Stephen Colbert (@StephenAtHome) July 25, 2013

So far, nobody is asking Harmon about Community. Maybe because if we do, he'll just talk about it. #tcas13

i wonder if Dan Harmon will leave this session mid-way, then come back after it goes off the rails without him. #tcas13 #rickandmorty

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 24, 2013

"I say what is in my head," Dan Harmon says, explaining both his candor and perhaps some of the drawbacks of working with him. #tcas13

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) July 24, 2013

Harmon blames being taken out of context and "third hand blogs" for his PR troubles, says he "[doesn't] want to try" to chill out. #tcas13

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 24, 2013

If you didn't know from the interviews and podcasts and panels and gatherings and TV shows, Dan Harmon has a lot to say about Dan Harmon.

@midwestspitfire Yeah, I thought he was going with being sorry and trying to think before speaking, but apparently he changed his mind.

@nprmonkeysee To be fair, he totally lasted until the next time he had to speak in public!

Oh good, more Dan Harmon. I feel like I don't get to hear enough from him.
